title: Abrogation
summary: The verbs abrogate and arrogate are quite different in meaning. summary: a high point of land or rock projecting into a body of water

title: Solpugas
summary: species of spider

title: Mygale
summary: mouse; any of a family of small chiefly nocturnal insectivores related to the moles and distinguished by a long pointed snout, very small eyes, and short velvety fur

title: Basilisks
summary: a legendary reptile with fatal breath and glance

title: Scrog
summary: a stunted shrub, bush, or branch

title: Fulgurite
summary: an often tubular vitrified crust produced by the fusion of sand or rock by lightning

title: Convoked
summary: to call together to a meeting

title: Keelsons
summary: a longitudinal structure running above and fastened to the keel of a ship in order to stiffen and strengthen its framework

summary: a water passage where the tide meets a river current

title: Sclera

title: Baldric

title: Lemniscate
summary: a figure-eight shaped curve
source: Blood Meridian, or Redness in the West

title: Pugmill

title: Denizenry
summary: an inhabitant
source: Blood Meridian, or Redness in the West

title: Ferric
summary: of, relating to, or containing iron

title: Boletas
summary: ticket
source: Blood Meridian, or Redness in the West

title: Cholla
summary: any of numerous shrubby opuntias chiefly of the southwestern U.S. and Mexico that have needlelike spines partly enclosed in a papery sheath and cylindrical joints

title: Jornadas
summary: an arduous usually one-day journey across a stretch of desert

title: Concomitant

summary: Cucumber

title: Balesome
summary: definition unknown

summary: definition unknown

title: Dunnage

title: Priapic
summary: relating to or preoccupied with virility or male sexual excitement

title: Doubloons
summary: an old gold coin of Spain and Spanish America
source: Blood Meridian, or Redness in the West

title: Alcades
summary: the chief administrative and judicial officer or the mayor of a town in a Spanish-speaking country or region

title: Cabildo

title: Skein
summary: a loosely coiled length of yarn or thread wound on a reel

title: Thaumaturge

title: Atavistic
summary: recurrence in an organism of a trait or character typical of an ancestral form and usually due to genetic recombination

title: Fard
summary: to paint (the face) with cosmetics

title: Wickiup

title: Suttee

title: Croupier

title: Armatures

title: Mansuete

title: Sated
summary: to appease by indulging to the full

title: Replevined
summary: an action originating in common law and now largely codified by which a plaintiff having a right in personal property which is claimed to be wrongfully taken or detained by the defendant seeks to recover possession of the property and sometimes to obtain damages for the wrongful detention

title: Alcalde
summary: the chief administrative and judicial officer or the mayor of a town in a Spanish-speaking country or region

title: Fistula
summary: an abnormal passage that leads from an abscess or hollow organ or part to the body surface or from one hollow organ or part to another and that may be surgically created to permit passage of fluids or secretions

title: Terminus
summary: either end of a transportation line or travel route

title: Atavistic
summary: recurrence in an organism of a trait or character typical of an ancestral form and usually due to genetic recombination

title: Galena
summary: a bluish-gray cubic mineral with metallic luster consisting of lead sulfide and constituting the principal ore of lead

title: Tyrolean
summary: of a hat : of a style originating in the Tyrol and marked by soft often green felt, a narrow brim and pointed crown, and an ornamental feather

title: Crinoline
